website_summaries.verdict: This commercial-strength vacuum can tackle almost any job, including pet hair, but it doesn't have a hose.
pros: Lightweight unit that's easy to maneuver
Works great for households with pets
Built to stand up to heavy use
cons: No hose for cleaning stairs or hard-to-reach areas

website_summaries.verdict: U.S.-made Oreck Commercial line is powerful and trusted.
pros: Designed for low-pile carpets and hardwood floors
Arthritis Foundation approves this vacuum for ease of use
cons: Although the cord is long, it isn't retractable and tangles easily

customer_reviews.title: Back to the basics.. Don't let the out-dated ...
customer_reviews.text: Back to the basics.. Don't let the out-dated ergonomics and style of this Oreck fool you. I’ve owned a shark, a dyson, Hoover, kennmore, Electrolux, even a variety of wet-dry vacuums. This Oreck out performs them all, on both tile & carpet. A+ Oreck
customer_reviews.author: VcantSeee

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend it at all
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews before purchasing this vacuum. I do not recommend it at all. It doesn't pick up cat litter or sand on regular floors. Does ok on carpet. I decided to return this and buy an upright Electrolux and when it came in the mail I used this vacuum and the new one in the same day. The new Electrolux sucked up everything and this oreck sucked up crap. I have 3 pets and don't recommend this vacuum
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Cochran

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: We had an Oreck for 15 years and loved it. It finally died so we decided we had such good luck we would get another one. Bad mistake. We have had it 2 weeks. We have to take it apart each time and clean the brushes. The dog hair gets into where the brush turns and stops the brush from turning. Once cleaned it works again. Sometimes we can’t even get one room vacuumed and it jams up again. We vacuum every day so it is not like we have a build up of dirt. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The bag for this vacuum keeps detaching from the inside and crap goes all over the inside. It’s also not picking stuff up now. This isn’t even a year old. This is the 3rd oreck I’ve owned and this has never happened. There should be some sort of warranty or return period before the year is up. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Jfcooper

customer_reviews.title: Light and very good quality!
customer_reviews.text: No more bagless for us. Emptying those dust,hair,flea filled cups into the garbage and having it poof back in my face was disgusting and was bad for my allergies. I gave both bagless vacs to Goodwill and bought two bagged vacuums, 1 was this Oreck, And we love it! At 57 I worry about me and my wife pushing around a vac that is too heavy and hurting our backs.. The Oreck is light and easy to move and doesn't strain our backs. Pull the bag out and put it in the trash, install a new bag and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: transmitterguy

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this product. I have owned Orecks in the past but this vacuum has had nothing but problems. I have done all the trouble shooting but the suction is non existent and I can feel the dirt being thrown at my ankles as I attempt to clean the carpet...forget about the hardwood. Am going to explore the supposed one year warranty and see what can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Mom-o-six

customer_reviews.title: What they said...
customer_reviews.text: It has been confirmed... this vacuum sucks! I don’t have pets but my hair sheds a lot. I have not had one problem with this machine in a month. I use it twice a week. Other bag less vacuums give problems after one or two uses. It is also very light weight. I will give another update in 6 months. I’m sure this will last for years!
customer_reviews.author: Evangelyn Moore

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our small motel because we have industrial, low pile carpet and it was advertised to be great for this. It also got great reviews. After just two weeks I am so unhappy. The vacuum does not suck up any strings or lint off the carpet even if they are resting loosely on top and not embedded in the fibers. My housekeeper has to keep bending over to pick things up off the carpet. I rely heavily on reviews from other consumers so I am not sure why this is so terrible for our business.
customer_reviews.author: Keith J. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my last Oreck (same model) after 15 yrs and was very optimistic to get the same quality vaccum. Too bad, first time I used it, it died on me a couple times — maybe there is a lose connection somewhere? It came back to life later but it has no power. I go over crumbs or hair, slowly, many times and it just moves the dirt around instead of sucking it up! I contacted Amazon about the problems and they referred me to Oreck. Now I missed my return window by 3 days. What a rip off!
customer_reviews.author: eli

customer_reviews.title: Oreck is not the Same!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve loved Oreck vacuums before so when replacing my flooded vacuum, this was a logical choice. This vacuum was not the same quality. The bag attachment system was three 1/8” cardboard tabs that are supposed to hold the bag on. Not good. It went back. The cord is long and awkward...I guess the long cord gave it the “commercial” label. There are much better choices!
customer_reviews.author: J. Heinlein

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't pick up debri on sides
customer_reviews.text: Although this vacuum is light, very light, strong suction and fabulous long cord it leaves a VERY wide space on either side where it doesn't pick up debri. I thought along side of my baseboards weren't looking like that freshly vacuumed carpet look. But then during Christmas and vacuuming up the numerous pine needles it was apparent that this vacuum leaves large gaps on either side where it is not able to pick up dirt. The left side there is a 2" space and the right the vacuum doesn't pick up 1". This is a very bad design flaw and I am returning this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Malinda

customer_reviews.title: A Vacuum for Everyone.
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a lighter vacuum that was easy to handle. We have medium and short thread carpets. (There is no height adjustment so it's not for heavy rugs.) Our previous vacuum was so powerful it would jam trying to lift the carpet (!). This one works perfectly. It has an easy to change bag that you can squeeze to determine its fullness. That's a good thing since this vacuum picks up twice as much dirt. I haven't measured it but the cord seems to be a mile long. We are very satisfied. Note: there are no attachments, but that's OK.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Husband

customer_reviews.title: The bag exploded while vacuuming
customer_reviews.text: The bag exploded while vacuuming that caused a lot of mess inside and outside of the outer bag that left me with lot of cleaning. Now I can't even use the vacuum cleaner even if i purchase new bags because the outer bag doesn't fit after the wash. I have used this vacuum cleaner for two months only after the purchase. Will not not buy another Oreck vacuum cleaner again even though the vacuum it self performs well until the paper bag explodes while using it. Very disappointed in Oreck and their customer service is the worst one. Hence, took 3 stars off.
customer_reviews.author: Sobers

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Wife had no idea I ordered this for her. She tried most of the other popular vacumes. Complained about the others having no suction, wouldn't clean on tile floors. Some confusing about parts replacement. Just on and on. She opened this box and just staired at this plain Jane vacum. No accessories, nothing, just a vacum. The look on her face was unforgettable. She plugged it in, used it and said it was the best vacume she's ever used. Said she'd buy a smaller handheld for under the couch a d other things. She loved this. Great suction, extra long heavy cord. Does what you want it to do "vacume floors"
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Cheap version of an Oreck Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I had the Classic XL for probably 10 years and it was a great vacuum. I got this one thinking it would be similar...it is not. It is a more basic version. It does not have the two speed motor for bare floor and carpet. It does not have the light on the front to see the carpet in low light situations like under a bed, etc. It just feels cheaper as you vacuum. Pretty disappointed in this vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kent Pletcher

customer_reviews.title: Hate This Vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: As the previously happy owner of multiple Oreck vacuums, I assumed this would be the same. Wrong!! Main ongoing complaint is that the disposable dust bag has no explicit attachment to the unit -- per telecom with Oreck Customer Service, it's expected that suction alone will direct dirt into the bag. This poor design does not work!!! And this morning, only a scant 20 months into ownership, the on/off switch has failed. I have had it with Oreck, and will be researching other manufacturers for my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R WARNAS

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to Maneuver
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews in consumer magazines and online reviews, I decided I wanted a bagged vacuum cleaner to help minimize my exposure to dust. I decided I wanted a simple upright vacuum cleaner with no attachments to clutter the vacuum and add weight. I wanted something easy to maneuver and light enough to carry up or down steps. The Oreck met these criteria, had good reviews, and was very reasonably priced. I can say I’m very satisfied with its performance and it definitely meets my criteria. It vacuums very well and is light. For steps and upholstery, I have a separate small low-priced shop vacuum that I used to complement my cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Proven design
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Orek in this model design. My previous lasted nearly 19 years before being retired. Although it still worked. I would have liked this model to have the light on the front. However this is a commercial grade vacuum design like what is used in hotels. It has a very long, thick gauge cord that does not tangle easily, easy to change the bag, easy to change the roller brush or belt. It makes a lot of noise but is light weight.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with this model.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum was an issue from the first time I needed replacement bags. When the belt went, trying to find an authorised dealer who had the belt and who could install it was a long time coming. The new belt didn't even hold for one vacuuming. Dealer wanted to charge another $80 for new roller and belt or $120 for overhaul. This item didn't last and they overcharge for repair and parts. Don't bother. Just go to Walmart and get the $50 vacuum. Yes they will break too, but at least you won't feel like you got suckered for $178.
customer_reviews.author: Y!

customer_reviews.title: It will probably be really good for every day use
customer_reviews.text: I used this at work, right now we are doing construction and there’s a lot of drywall and other types of dust and debris. The flooring is a glue down rubber flooring that you see at the gym. After using a shop vac, I use this. It makes a noticeable difference after the shop vac can’t pick up anymore but it doesn’t pick up everything. To be fair I think I need to use a wet vac to pick up the last 25%. It is surprisingly really light and the cord is nice and long. It is not obnoxiously loud but it’s also not quiet like an expensive vacuum cleaner. I would not run it during business hours.
customer_reviews.author: AmznAddictTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist vacuum that works great.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a "clean nut" who's very picky about vacuum cleaners. She recommended we buy this Oreck Commercial XL (after doing extensive research), and we haven't looked back! Talk about "minimalist" design. As far as I can glean, this vacuum has no features - no lights, no height adjustment, no flooring vs. carpet adjustment, no cord retraction mechanism, no place for accessories. Thus - nothing to break! It has a VERY long cord (which I love), it's light weight (ditto), it's easy to maneuver and has excellent suction. Oh, and it's not overly loud. We're very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F.

customer_reviews.title: Good suction
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my wife's parents. Tried it in our house first (easy to assemble) and did it a great job on our large area rug. Brought it to my in-laws and did all their area rugs plus the wooden floor. I gave a three star for stairs because the product is cumbersome to use on stairs unless they are very large. It is lite and easy to use on all types of floors. According to the book it looks like easy maintained. We were so impressed with the weight and power we purchased one for ourselves. It is going to replace a heavy hepa-filter bissel. Now I need to order extra bags for it.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Kareski

customer_reviews.title: Very Loud Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I fell bad for writing this, but hopefully this will help with less returns and customers satisfaction. I order this base on the high ratings. I'm sure it does a great job picking up dirt from carpets, however this vacuum sounds like a freight train when its running. Unfortunately I had to return it because I was using it for a condo HOA in the hallways. So it would have disturbed the residents I'm sure. If noise is not a concern for you, its probably a great vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: H. Windham

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these vacuums both of their motors started smoking wiring a month of each other. I will never purchase another Orel vacuum again!! I had an older Orel that lasted me for over 10 years. The new ones are plastic pieces of junk!! Orel should have to replace both of them due to the fact that they are both under 2 years old.and look brand new but believe me they a JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Marc smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog hair
customer_reviews.text: I love my oreck. I had one years ago and loved it but then repair and service store in my area went out of business. I then switched to bagless vacuums with Dyson being one of them. I am not a fan of bagless vacuums . This oreck is very noisy but I don't care I have two large dogs, one is a German shepherd that sheds like crazy and this vacuum takes the trophy.The price is just the cherry on the sundae
customer_reviews.author: lmrl39

customer_reviews.title: A Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports highly recommended this for senior citizens. It was light weight and the company has a good reputation. However I am very disappointed in it. My major reason is that I have never had a vacuum cleaner that was harder to push. Other negatives ( although it is my fault for not researching better) include no attachments, cord is annoying to wind and it is the heaviest eight pounds I have ever lifted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst vacuum we have ever owned. Very difficult to push on large area carpet. Does not pick up pet hair very well on wall to wall Berber type carpet. Cheaply built. Manufacturer provided base plate for higher pile carpet that makes vacuuming useless. No light or accessories. Unable to move from room to room on back wheels without lowing the nozzle. No carpet height adjustment. The only positive feature is the long, heavy duty cord. Very disappointed after reading reviews. Must have been written by the company.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle U.P.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My parents have had one for over 15 years now. I've been through a few myself and decided to go with this as I knew they were great and lasted. This thing is super light weight and easy to carry around. Suction is great and my carpets feel more "clean" after using. I will say the downside is not having attachments but I bought the little vacuum they have with all the attachments to get in all the nooks and crannies and it's also great for vehicles. I got both the commercial models and I just love them. Bags aren't that expensive either.
customer_reviews.author: Turner

customer_reviews.title: I am going to keep very clean my house with this so valuable item !!!
customer_reviews.text: I would do like mention that I used several vacuums , and I didn’t find the right one; then I was doing a research and speaking with my relatives about their experiences. After few days, I bought this vacuum “Oreck XL”, not matter was designed on 2008, resulted very good product !!!! ; very easy the assembly (just needs a screwdriver), is very light (8 pounds), very good compartment for a large bag), excellent and long cord and you can clean under your bed . I strongly believe that this vacuum is very good asset for our house!!
customer_reviews.author: Julio E. Gonzalo

customer_reviews.title: It works....and amazingly well!
customer_reviews.text: It’s always a nerve wrecking job to find a vacuum. This one was basic and got good reviews so went for it. This vacuum does an outstanding job at sucking up everything in its path! One of the best vacuum purchases we have ever made. Highly surprised and pleased with this product. We have had it months...after a while I may come back with an update. If you are looking for a simple vacuum that will really clean...this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Rach'sRamblings

customer_reviews.title: IGNORE THE FAKE 1-STAR REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: Oreck has historically been and continues to be the leader of upright vacuums. We have had this commercial grade vacuum for about 3 years and we love the suction as it is so powerful and intimidating! Picks up dirt like there is no tomorrow. We also have other brands such as Hoover, Dyson and Black & Decker, and they all love to stay in the closet when Oreck is out :) I was NOT paid like other reviewers to post this brutally honest review. Buy this one with confidence and thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: De Marco Santana

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Orecks for 6 years, I have bought most of them at my local Oreck store. This Oreck I just bought is terrible, the quality is so disappointing, even the roller brush is made of plastic instead of wood. I can compare any of my other Orecks side by side and tell they have replaced lots of parts with poor quality and plastic parts. I am beyond disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: This vacuum is worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I ordered this. I was at first not sure it would actually be as good as the reviews but I tell you what i wish i would have bough this years ago. It's lightweight, take up very little room , and does the job way better than any vacuum I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Russell

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to wear ear plugs and pick up stuff by hand!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst vacuum I've ever used. It's beyond noisy and fails to pick up even the easiest things: a small leaf, a tiny scrap of paper, a tiny bit of dog hair. What's worse if that the directions even indicate that such things shouldn't even be tried to get picked up by the vacuum! What good is it? Even lacks a simple light at the front so you can see what's in front of you better.
customer_reviews.author: C. Alex Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good cost, do your research to make sure this model is best for your family
customer_reviews.text: I had an Oreck for 14 years, a fancy pink one that made me feel like Barbie when I vacuumed. It ran great but the dog odor was the guts of the vacuum Was so bad we tossed it. I should have had it cleaned again but I found a new version on A for $156. Let’s try it! There is only 1 setting - on or off. My old fancy pink one had 2 modes. It seems to bust a moove picking up dust bunnies and the such. I think I like it, I would really prefer a fun color if we are gonna do this whole retro thing but regardless, it works well!
customer_reviews.author: MomtoAlex

customer_reviews.title: 100db - will eventually make you deaf
customer_reviews.text: love this vacuum but noticed it was much louder than prior Oreck.. used an app to measure the sound level and it hovered around 98-100 db which can damage your hearing if exposed to this sound level just 15 mins per day.. it's really too bad cause it works really well and is very light.. will still buy an Oreck, but will return this one first..
customer_reviews.author: TX Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 16 months!
customer_reviews.text: Well, it only lasted 16 months! The bag also slips off the connection and blows dust into the cloth bag, which releases into the air. The motor burned out today. So I looked to see when I purchased it - only 16 months ago. It worked well up to this time, although it was very loud (probably because it was a Commercial grade). I am buying a Dyson next. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent No-Frills Vaccum Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I personally love this vacuum. Powerful, very light weight, great price. My wife doesn't like it quite as much as it lacks bells and whistles like a detachable wand etc. She also says that it doesn't clean along edges as well as she'd like. Our last two overpriced floor vacuum cleaners never performed to our satisfaction and broke way too early. I see this model used in hotels so I'm anticipating that it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jam Meister

customer_reviews.title: Powerful vacuum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vacuum cleaner as a replacement for an Oreck I had for 20 years. This new one is powerful, it picks up on carpet as well as hardwood floors. It's light weight and easy to use. It doesn't work well on stairs but it wasn't designed for that. I have a small Oreck hand held vacuum cleaner for the stairway. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AvgConsumer57

customer_reviews.title: Best vacuum ever!
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Worked great for pet hair. I literally vaccumed with my old canister vac that morning & the canister had just a little dust in the bottom. The oreck arrived that afternoon so I wanted to try it out, after one time vaccuming, the bad was half full! I never realized how much my old vacuum was missing until I got this oreck. Bonuses, no stinky, nasty canister to empty or yucky filters to wash. Just pop the bag out & throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: RRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Customer Kept In Mind
customer_reviews.text: A real work-horse. Light weight, and cleans well. They kept the customer in mind when they designed this vacuum. I like how they designed the end-caps of the beater-bar (new & old setting) to indicate a height step, so I can rotate the setting 180° to raise the beater-bar height by .050" when it starts to wear, instead of having to replace it right away. I also like how they designed the bottom section to hold a spare belt, and the easy access to change the belt. No bells & whistles means less could go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: William Crader

customer_reviews.title: Sooo heavy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have something to use on carpet and vinyl floors. It is so hard to push on carpet that I have to have my husband do it. Decided to get a different, lighter one so I’m able to do it.
customer_reviews.author: arnp

customer_reviews.title: Bagged vac does only one thing but excels at it
customer_reviews.text: I've had my 8-lb. Oreck commercial vacuum for years now, and it is still going strong. I keep checking the roller brush for wound-up hair, and it doesn't have any, but it does an excellent job at sucking up dirt. This is a very one-dimensional vacuum -- it has no tools nor is it meant for carpeted stairs or for hard floors -- but it has outlasted many a vacuum in my house and continues to work as well as it did on day one. The bags are not expensive. We've gotten our money's worth here.
customer_reviews.author: MolokoVellocet

customer_reviews.title: It does the job it’s not overpriced and they last about five years and I just keep buying them
customer_reviews.text: These are disposable they last a long time once you burn them up they’re so cheap possum in the garbage and buy another one I like that they go under chairs because it’s economically designed if it’s right under a chair. Work isn’t top and stuff but it is nice and I’ve been buying it for years and I will continue for $133 it’s a good deal I thought the other one in the garbage every five years and buy another one
customer_reviews.author: Crusher

customer_reviews.title: Terrible on carpets!
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum is powerful and lightweight as it seems all Orecks are. However it is TERRIBLE on carpets that are not just a flat pile. I could barely push it on the carpeting. Very disappointed. We are returning this for a non commercial one. Two other missing features: no lights and only one power level. I generally really like Orecks, but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Frey

customer_reviews.title: You don’t need a bag less vacuum with all those attachments.
customer_reviews.text: This is for people who understand how to deep clean and (like me) hate bag-less vacuums dan attachments. (We all know that bag less are dirty, never last, and loose suction over time.) This is also for the minimalist who cleans regularly and doesn’t need the trendy features... it simply cleans like a boss. This, and my Boma are all I need to clean my floors. Excellent buy for the money and does exactly what you’d expect - vacuums up EVERYTHING.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sandi Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Oreck Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Well, My only other vacuum that I had since 1990, was the Oreck xl. Old sucker gave up the ghost and died last week! I don't know any vacuum that lasted that long. I have 4 large rooms with large area rungs..around 20x25 ft. and all the rest have hardwood floors. The new Oreck is great. It actually does a great job on the floors..better actually for floors than old Sucker. I love this product..and am hoping to get a long life out of it.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Could be worse, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: It is louder than I expected. Also the power cord is connected to the handle in two separate places, which makes the cord more prone to get in a knot while wrapping it up. I also was unable to get the screws to secure the handle to the base of the vacuum. I asked a friend to help and they couldn't do it either. I will use duct-tape. For the sake of not wanting to pay an arm and a leg for a vacuum, it's less of a hassle to work with what I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, LOVE THIS!! I chose it because of its slim 12" width for easy storage. It is so powerful sometimes it suctions to the carpet so tight I have tilt it to make it move again! If you like your carpets cleaned you'll get this. It also has a super long, high-end cord. It has no hose or wand. No parts and attachments. (I have a little canister vac for my hardwoods that has a wand. This vac I bought just for the carpets.) My daughter said another good thing about it is that it looks old fashioned, so if a thief breaks in he won't take it because it looks old. Hahaha
customer_reviews.author: interplanetjanet

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is very lightweight and does a GREAT job. My only negative is that it is very hard to push on carpet. It's super easy on hard surfaces, but not on my carpet, which is nowhere near "plush." I was hoping that it would be easier to push. I still really like it, but sometimes have to use two hands to get it to go forward.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Buy it! Its light, powerful, and it destroys dog hair.
customer_reviews.text: My riccar died 2 weeks ago and I have 3 adult german shepherds, I attached the handle, checked for a bag plugged it in and we got started on 1800 sq ft of dog hair. It picked up everything first pass. Beater bar stayed clean the whole time. Feels like it pulls you forward because the brush is scrubbing so hard. Its light and powerful. Cons: bag is kinda wierd to secure and install, and the extremely long power cord could use a better cradle. I dont do a lot of reviews but I will revisit this one if performance changes. Oh, also it showed up 3 days early
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: My husband put it together as soon as it arrived and I had to try it out. I had had an Oreck which lasted over 20 years and this one is great!
customer_reviews.author: JCMills

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Oreck Models Until problem Fixed
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 3 weeks. First no suction and then shortly thereafter not working at all. I have not purchased many vacuums from Oreck recently, but I would avoid this model until it is fixed. The short duration it was used it did the job though. Furthermore, getting a refund for a $175 vacuum is a nightmare. Have to drive 40 minutes to another town so that they may or may not fix. What happened to warrantees? That is a bit of cash to be out in the event a problem occurs. Do yourself a favor and buy somewhere local and avoid shipping a vacuum from Oreck.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Hard to push
customer_reviews.text: This Oreck has a heavy shop cord. I can't handle it. Also, is not easy to push on light pile carpet. It does not go under average furniture. Don't like it at all. It isn't like the Oreck I had years ago. I liked that one. I am 78 and this Oreck s light enough for me to lift, but I can hardly push it on the carpet. I don't know for the life of me, why they put such a heavy cord on it. Ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: Good for my long haired sheddy dog
customer_reviews.text: My Bissell Pet eraser recently broke, and I was looking for a good all around vacuum to clean up after my dog, who leaves clumps of hair everywhere she goes. Despite not being a specific "pet" vacuum this cleaned up the clumps very well, and leaves the carpet looking much more suctioned than the Bissell ever did. Putting the handle on the vacuum is the only thing you need to do when it comes, and just need a philips screwdriver for that, simple. So far very happy with it, used 3x.
customer_reviews.author: C.Feldmann

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this Oreck vacuum
customer_reviews.text: The Oreck vacuum is a piece of junk. I understand this is a basic model but the paper bag barely lasts for 2 vacuuming sessions and then starts blowing dirt inside the main bag. The bag zipper is already damaged after 3 months. The unit is not very maneuverable. I won't buy another Oreck product based on the poor quality of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wise

customer_reviews.title: Great for cookie crumbs 'n stuff
customer_reviews.text: With all the cookies I feed to the fat kids in my neighborhood, it's no wonder that I am always struggling to clean up cookie crumbs. Oreck to the rescue. This thing does the trick and even has enough power for the mounds of pubic hair and toenail clippings that seemingly collect in every corner of my humble home. One time, I set up some plastic army men and ran over them with the Oreck pretending that it was a giant, crazed robot. Yes, the robot won the battle.
customer_reviews.author: Philistine Frank

customer_reviews.title: Effective bag vacuum cleaner - made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in 5 minutes - most of that time was reading the instructions. Yes, has a bag for catching all the crap the vacuum picks up. So tired of spending an hour cleaning my old bagless Hoover! Love the bag. Some have said it is loud. Not me, seemed normal to me. Cleans carpets and hard floor very well - and that is all it does. Like it. Long cord. Made in America. No bells and whistles, but so what, I have other vacuum cleaners to do that stuff. Nice product. Good price. Made in America.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Threshie

customer_reviews.title: Light weight vacuum-Arthritis Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have known about Oreck for over 25 years and I needed a lighter weight vacuum now as I am 71 and I have a bad back, it only weighs 8.2 pounds. I love that it has a long cord, 40 feet so you don't have to stop and change outlets to keep vacuuming. *The suction is great and is very efficient in cleaning. This vacuum is also great for those with arthritis as it has an easy-grip handle with the on-off switch located in the handle. It is also easy to use what vacuuming under dining-room chairs and around tables. Easy bag replacement. Easy to store. #lightweightvacuum
customer_reviews.author: Karren Haller

customer_reviews.title: Great for general carpet/floor vacuuming
customer_reviews.text: Vacuums up pet hair on carpet like nobodies business. This replaced a 20 year old Oreck XL21. This one is more cheaply made and doesn't have some of the extras my old one had, but the technology is the same and it works great. If it only lasts 5 years or so, at this price I will be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Beejer

customer_reviews.title: nightmare
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the zipper on the bag broke right away. Then, the vacuum bag will not stay on whether it is clicked or not. Dust gets everywhere. I'm crying right now. I am so upset. What a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Sarkees

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about a month ago and I am glad I did. My last Oreck finally gave up the ship after 18 years. This new one works great, makes my old carpet stand up again. This one does not have 2 settings like my old one and that's fine. It does automatically adjust itself from carpet to hard flooring, I love it plus the longer cord helps as well. The only con, it has no light but I can deal with that. I rate this vac a 9 1/2!
customer_reviews.author: S. Mathes

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: We use these for daily upkeep of vacation rentals. They do not seem to last as long as before. It may have something to do with the motor? They work well brand new! Easy to use and the bags are easy to change out. On the noisier side, so if you aren't used to that it may surprise you.
customer_reviews.author: Tai

customer_reviews.title: The Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: Have used only Oreck vacuum for at least the last 25 years. They are so light weight with tremendous suction makes for super easy cleaning. Love the commercial style due to the extremely long cord. Live in a 1700 sq ft home and plug in center of house and can literally reach end corners without unplugging. When first recv'd some people (especially on the shorter side) feel that the item is very tall in the upright position, but once put into motion, it's simply the best of the best. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back.  Handle would not attach  properly.
customer_reviews.text: Basic assembly required of attaching handle to bottom stem. I removed the plastic protector installed for shipping the item. I removed the two screws from the bracket. One screw was the wrong size. Directions showed one longer screw than the other. Top of handle would not slide over the stem to line up with bottom holes. Metal top of handle was same size as bottom -- you can't place handle over bottom when they're both the same size width. Therefore, the screws and bracket could not be attached to hold the handle in place. Very disappointing...sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: EmCotton11

customer_reviews.title: Put many scratches in hardwood floor before I realized it stinks!
customer_reviews.text: Our older version of the Oreck XL was a beauty for about ten years, until it died. I assumed this one would be terrific, too. And before I realized what was happening, it put dozens of scratches in our hardwood floors! Oreck claims this product works on hardwood. WRONG!!! They should be ashamed of themselves. I would give it zero stars if I could because of this. There should be a WARNING when you buy it and in the package--but rather Oreck CLAIMS you can use it on hardwood. WRONG.
customer_reviews.author: TG5282

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully replacement will have all necessary parts that work properly.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get a chance to use because the screw holes had nothing to screw into. I had to return for an exchange. Hopefully the new one won't be damaged and I can actually use it. I've seen other posts about there only being one screw. There's supposed to be 2.
customer_reviews.author: LaVonne Raber

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a vacuum that would clean all of my carpets well ( without charging up a battery mid way.. and without emptying a small cup and cleaning the filter every time!) This vacuum cleaner is loud. The heavy duty cord is lonnnng. But I can cover several rooms without unplugging and loud just makes me move faster. I still like my cordless, bagless dyson.. but will use this one when I’ve just gotta “ git er dun”!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Scout

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This is one serious MF'er of a vacuum!!! It does just one thing, but it does it extremely well - suck! I've lost count of the bagless vacuums I've bought over the years...I hated spending money on those dirty units. No more! My best friend has had one of these for years, and when I used it while staying with him, I was impressed with its ability. Long cord, relatively small format head that still is wide enough to make vacuuming large floors easy, and it's suction power made me a believer. You won't regret this purchase, but remember it's only a simple vacuum, with no attachments. I'm okay with that.
customer_reviews.author: h53driver

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum failed less than 35 days...
customer_reviews.text: At first we thought this was a solid vacuum, light weight, seemed to have plenty of power. Nothing fancy, but its an Oreck, so we thought it would last. Unfortunately, it didn't last 35 days. The brush fails to spin, and it no longer picks anything up. The "return window" closed a few days ago, so we are trying to arrange for a warranty return from Oreck, but we are disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Susy W.

customer_reviews.title: The roller is constantly getting jammed
customer_reviews.text: Amazon and Oreck have been great about honoring the warranty. We have had to take it to a service center a couple times. The technician said that the problem is we purchased a foreign manufactured Oreck that is on the cheaper side and couldn't fix it. We have to buy a separate roller that works better.
customer_reviews.author: John T Newman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to love this vacuum but it’s been trouble since we bought it. I’ve had it almost a year now and I’ve never had to work on a vacuum so many times! The belts are constantly burning up. I replace, cut out all the hair (we have dogs and teenage girls) and get it going again after vacuuming for 5 minutes it smells like it’s going to catch fire. Oh yes, what a great excuse for teens to get out of doing chores. It’s junk and I wouldn’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brewster

customer_reviews.title: It's light and fast and simple.
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year I can honestly say the Oreck is a fantastic vacuum. I've bought ever type of vacuum on the market for the last 30 years, this combines all the best of ideas and removes the worst of ideas of what a vacuum should do or how it should operate. Just ask the pile of broken cyclone and whirlwind plastic housings that couldn't seal if you glued them with a caulking gun of RTV. The Oreck is simple, basic but proven ideas that have lasted the test of time. I predict it will outlast every vacuum out there.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to push on medium to high pile carpets.
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to push on my medium and higher pile carpet. It worked okay on my older lower pile carpet Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: rooster 1

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum and good price
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought this vacuum a few vacuums ago. It’s light so it’s easy to carry around the house. Suction is very strong on carpets and stone floors. It’s easy to store because it’s narrow and takes up only a small patch of floor in a closet. I also like that it is attachment free as someone always seems to lose or break them. Update August 2019: Still the best vacuum I’ve ever owned. It’s lightweight and quick to drag out and put away. I find I vacuum more often than I used to when I had a larger canister vac.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down over the years
customer_reviews.text: We bought our first Oreck in 1997 and it lasted almost 20 years this new Oregon has barely lasted two years. The new models are cheaply made screws fall out collar connecting the upright pipe keeps coming off needless to say this will be the last one we buy
customer_reviews.author: Sawdust

customer_reviews.title: Worst vacuum I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: It's loud. Height doesn't adjust. Small wheels and low height make it VERY difficult to push, and IMPOSSIBLE to pull. Cannot use on stairs. Cannot use for books, crannies, or crevices. Checked bag after 1 month of use - only to find it EMPTY! So not only is it crap, it doesn't pick ANYTHING up, either. I always dreamed about owning an Oreck. Now I'll just go back to my old Dirt Devil. At least it works!
customer_reviews.author: Wes Prang

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: The more I use this machine the more I regret buying it. Oreck has cheapened their products to the point they are pure junk. I reviewed this machine earlier where I stated I was disappointed. Now I'm angry! I feel cheated. I trusted the name Oreck but never again. Doesn't matter what they put on the market, I'll not go near it. The lack of two speeds, a headlamp, the overly heavy cord, the fact it picks up when it feels like it so I have to go over and over the same spot. I've got a non-motorized carpet sweeper that does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Belt broke in 1st Week
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves Oreck brand so I gave in to this vacuum. Regular house. Regular low shag carpets. No dog hair. Son was complaining it was kinda heavy today. Saw that the roller bar not spinning. Thought it was on a bare floor mode. Nope. There isn't one. Then saw the rubber belt broke. Doesn't look like it had caught and burned thru. Looks more like a corner of it peeled and was weak. Was about to return item and saw an extra belt. Will see how long this one works but hope it's a fluke before buying more belts. Bags yes. Belts nope.
customer_reviews.author: Ian S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and simply effective vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Hoover Windtunnel so will compare and contrast the two... The Oreck is simple and lightweight, but vacuums my carpeted living space nicely. It's quieter than my Hoover so don't know what other reviewers are critical of here. No wand attachment, no self propel feature, or height adjustment and somewhat narrower base are my final observations but it works as I hoped it would so I am satisfied! As a bachelor, why would I want anything else?
customer_reviews.author: Hung Lo

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at a great price during Prime days. Was excited to have an Oreck. Perhaps I didn't read enough reviews, although I thought I did. It's very powerful, picks up well, including around baseboards. BUT I almost need to wear earplugs; it sounds similar to a jet taking off AND it's very hard to manipulate on carpet. Don't dare vacuum against the grain. It takes two hands and all your strength. Not easy to turn. Maybe I need to hone my vacuuming skills, but I haven't had such issues with other brands I've had. Very hard on my lower back and shoulder. I haven't decided whether I'm going to return it yet. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing about it is that it is not a canister bag less vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Very good vacuum. Very happy with it. I have 2 dogs, 3 cats & a bunny. Lots of shedding here! Best thing about this vacuum is that it is NOT a canister bag less vacuum. I was very much over them. Went thru 3 of them. I was so tired of them getting stuck with hair. I had to keep my screwdriver handy at all times and take apart the whole thing to clean it out. Constantly. This vacuum doesn’t swivel, so it does take a little getting used to, but I will take that any day over the dust and dirt when emptying a canister!!! Great vacuum. Great price. Love the bags.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Serafin

customer_reviews.title: I've had this same vacuum in the past and I loved it so I just got a bum number
customer_reviews.text: Did not work - returned it. I've had this same vacuum in the past and I loved it so I just got a bum number. Grrr. I'm getting my Oreck Magnesium fixed instead but it's going to cost almost the same amount.
customer_reviews.author: SaintRoch

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this brand
customer_reviews.text: A piece of sh. The design is terrible. The handle and tube to the bag are one in the Same and even with a PIpe Wrench will not stay together. Finally duck taped together so I could pull back while vacuuming. Will not even pick up dog hair on tile. I have fought with this for two years and I am fed up with it. Just use it for linoleum and low carpet, nothing demanding it is so terrible I will not even bother with giving it to good will. Shameful product. A vacuum should last 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy!
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed so far....vacuumed 3 rooms....vac made a strange noise and stopped....wouldn’t do anything but make a humming noise. Nothing stuck in/on beater bar/roller brush. Attempted to remove bottom panel to have a look inside, only to discover that I’ll have to purchase a special screw driver to do so. I have customers to take care of....if this is the way it’s going to be, I’ll be returning this for a FULL REFUND!
customer_reviews.author: C. Hinshaw

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I use it at home. This is a great hardwood or tile vacuum. Works fair on carpet. Not as good as you would have hoped. Most of my home is hard flooring so it's perfect for me. It's meant for commercial use so I'm very pleased with it. Super light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck - works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this vacuum. Our last one died (because we sucked up concrete during a remodeling job), and we bought the exact same one again. We have 2 dogs that shed - one with short hair and one with long hair. We use this vacuum almost daily to combat the constant hair accumulation. It cleans up all the dog hair very well. Super long cord is nice as well so you aren't having to constantly start and stop to find a closer outlet. Only complaint is that it doesn't have any accessories, like for vacuuming stairs or close to baseboards. We have a separate lightweight hose vaccum for those jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Andersen

customer_reviews.title: A "don't buy"
customer_reviews.text: This is one vacuum that works okay on carpet but not hard floors or vice versa. Vendor sent us an add on that raises vacuum head to take care of thick pile on carpet. But it either does not work on hard floors or you have to remove the head each time. I have rolled over pieces of thread or lint on hard floor and this vacuum did not pick it up. Had to bend over and pick it up by hand.
customer_reviews.author: GenKay

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning Business
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, I have a tiny cleaning business and this vacuum leaves the best carpet lines, my clients love it! It really make a room look and feel clean, I wouldn’t say it’s the most maneuverable for the stairs but I do use it weekly on stairs and it does just fine. Tip - throw a little carpet scent in the bag beforehand and everything will smell fresh!
customer_reviews.author: Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: My customer was happy
customer_reviews.text: I work for a hardware store I had a 85 year old women who wanted a Oreck vacuum because she need something light weight that she could move around the house with out hurting herself. My store don’t sell these vacuums not sure if they ever did. So I check on amazon and found it for her. She does not use computers so I use my account to get it for her. She loves this vacuum and was pleased as punch to have it delivered to her home.
customer_reviews.author: jermaine Hall

customer_reviews.title: Decent vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We use a lot of vacuums in our cleaning business. I use this one for all our janitorial accounts . It works well considering what we have to vacuum up . Some of my accounts have a lot of sand and and dirt we have vacuum up. The vacuum will usually last us a year before i have to replace it . The brush roll is cheap though, i have to replace it in three months use. All in all it’s a pretty decent vacuum
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Bernal

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: I used this two or three times week to vacuum one 8x10 rug. We have hardwood floors so the living room rug is the only thing that needs vacuuming. After two years it started smelling like electrical burn, then smoke started coming out of it. A vacuum really should last longer than two years, especially one you don’t use a lot. Really disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Talbot

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this vacuum. I've had for about a year now and it still amazes me how well it works. Most of my life, I've used cheap $50 vacuums, all bagless, and they all kicked it within the first year. This guy is still going strong. My seven year old can use it. It's so light weight and maneuverable. It works well on my kitchen floor and I use it on my couch. I have a Pomeranian so pet hair is pretty much my life. This vacuum takes care of it no problem. I keep trying to convince my cheap mom to buy one :).
customer_reviews.author: joseph hicks

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with my sweeper!
customer_reviews.text: said no one ever...but my relationship with this vacuum cleaner is close to true love...it comes from a good family...does what is supposed to do...cleans up well... and is a great addition to the family..all joking aside..I am very happy with my sweeper...it's lightweight,has great suction power,and picks up all my tiny scrapbook trash
customer_reviews.author: theresca a robins

customer_reviews.title: only one suction level
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son in his apartment. apparently there is only one setting/ one suction level which is very strong. you can't adjust from floor to carpet. had I known this i would have purchased a different machine. no attachments for furniture
customer_reviews.author: Linda J.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: My wife absolutely hated this vacuum. She found that it was loud, difficult to use, and cleaned extremely poorly. Compared to the Shark Navigator Lift-Away NV352 we already have, it was a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Rogers

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is easy to use. Just plug it in and turn it on and go. It is lightweight and easy to maneuver, and can slide under our beds too (well, a bit tight but it fits). My only wish is that it had a hose and a couple onboard tools for dusting. I got it mostly because it can go under beds with a 6 inch clearance. The dust bag is great because it acts as a filter, and is easy to replace. I used to have a bagless and I hate cleaning out the dust bin--total yuck and messy. I'll never get a bagless vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: slimmX

customer_reviews.title: This product is unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely difficult to use - have to exert more energy than I have to push it on low pile carpet. I am 84 years old and do not have the strength to operate this vacuum. I had an Oreck that was very easy to use that wore out. I need a vacuum that will pick up dirt and be easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Edited - lasted about 4 months, handle is now broken. Horrible design for a vacuum. The whole handle is held together by a poorly fitting piece of plastic. It works well, in terms of suction, etc., but it is not useable without a handle. I guess I need to look into an Oreck warranty or something. Works great, very lightweight. No gadgets, but for the price and function, not an issue. Should be performing for us for many years. Used it for a couple months now, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Bags are better
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is fantastic. I got tired of the bagless vac, it's dirty and messy, so I wanted a bagger. The Oreck is very light, it's easy to carry up and down stairs. It's narrow, so it fits in tight spaces and corners. The front end is low, it gets under sofas and cabinets. It goes from carpet to hardwood without any adjustments. The suction is strong. A week after I got this a potted plant fell over dumping potting soil on a deep pile carpet, the Oreck sucked it all up like a snack. It doesn't have attachments, which I think is a benefit, it makes the machine lighter, smaller, more nimble. It's like the sports car of vacuums.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic M

product_meta.title: Oreck Commercial XL2100RHS Commercial Upright Vacuum Cleaner XL,Blue
product_meta.description: Style:Oreck Commercial UprightThe Oreck XL Commercial Upright Vacuum is a commercial grade vacuum that offers all the power and performance you expect from an Oreck. This versatile upright makes it easy to keep your business clean. It gets up close to cabinets and baseboards and fits easily under most furniture, clothes racks, chairs and desks. It can be used on all surfaces including carpet, wood, laminate and tile with no manual height adjustment. Weighing about 9 pounds, it's lightweight and covers a 12" wide area which makes cleaning easy and quick. It has the exclusive Microsweep feature that allows you to switch from carpet to bare floors with no adjustments and a 630 cubic inch “top fill” bag. Cord guard prevents cord damage. Fingertip-controlled on/off switch. Ingenious top-fill design ensures no loss of suction and keeps power at maximum even while bag fills. This model comes with a 1-year commercial warranty as well as a 1-year warranty on the belt. Refer instruction manual before use.
feature_bullets: POWERFUL, HIGH-SPEED, balanced brush roll with double helix brushes
LIGHTWEIGHT 9 pounds with Helping Hand handle
12-INCH-WIDE CLEANING PATH is better suited for cleaning low carpets and takes up less space for storage
AUTOMATIC FLOOR ADJUSTMENT - moves between carpet and hard surfaces by auto adjusting to flooring height

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
